Reasonably offtopic: does anyone else play Fantasica? I've just started a week ago, looks like it could be fun. If you do play then it'd be good to add you as an ally, be nice to have someone from here to talk to.

If you don't play and want to find out what I'm talking about: It's a CCG meets tower defence game, available on Android and iPhone. There are pay-to-play aspects, but you can get by quite well without paying any real money if you've got spare time to grind and a shrewd head for trading. (trading is currently disabled while a special event runs for a few days)
If anyone wants to give it a try, and isn't too put off by the intrusive permissions that the app asks for, then feel free to use my player ID as a sign-up reference after you complete the tutorial to get some free stuff, and gift me 1/20 of a free stuff. My number is 77960722 [spoiler for referral spam]
It's a bit clunky, but I like it.

But, yeah... not completely off-topic. I'm thinking about using the names from my army on there to name troopers here. Maybe even try to build an army where the troopers have matching skills. The AOE weapons should be fairly easy to map, along with the speed and suchlike, and I guess poison would transfer fairly well. Hmm, maybe this isn't as impossible an idea as I thought it would be haha. My current Fantasica army is 18 strong at the moment, so I'd have to drop someone to make it fit. Hmmmmmm.

What other games could be a good source of trooper names? Most of Zen Warriors are named after my soldiers in LSN. This game wouldn't be nearly as much fun if you couldn't name your troopers.

On may 23, 2013
Kompera

Question for the Forumites

What's better: On Point or Frenetic?

I've found that my Troopers with Frenetic are often killed by Troopers who have On Point and act first. Even my Spies with their significant starting initiative bonus can be shot down before they get a chance to act if there is an On Point Trooper in the enemy deployment.

On the other hand, once it gets going, a Frenetic Trooper can be nigh unstoppable. Frenetic Troopers can easily wade through 4+ enemy Troopers with ease, fueling their rampage on the corpses of those they have already killed. It is an amazing thing to see.

So, which do you prefer? A theme army of one or the other, or an army where you mix the two? This is of course assuming that you don't prefer Smart or some other starting skill, just assume that your only options are On Point or Frenetic.

And please, of course the best option is both, but aside from the starting skill there are no guarantees. So please treat this as a starting skill choice only.

On may 25, 2013
[1841726]
KomperaQuestion for the Forumites

What's better: On Point or Frenetic?

So, which do you prefer? A theme army of one or the other, or an army where you mix the two? This is of course assuming that you don't prefer Smart or some other starting skill, just assume that your only options are On Point or Frenetic.

And please, of course the best option is both, but aside from the starting skill there are no guarantees. So please treat this as a starting skill choice only.

As for me,"On-point" might be the only skill in the "must-have" category. While "Frenetic" is definitely in the "perks" category. It is just that the benefit of frenetic, most of the times, can be nigh overpowered that it can breach the "must-have" category. This is evident on spies; as I would prefer, maybe most of you will agree, on-point spies over frenetic spies. But frenetic spies are no push-over either.

But there's a rub, as on-point's efficiency decreases as the number of troopers with on-point in the field increases. Whereas, frenetic all of the time is a welcome addition to any trooper in the army.

So a competitive army must have,but it should not be saturated with, on-point troopers.

My ideal scenario: If in an army formation there are 3 waves and each wave has 4 troopers. There should be 1-2 troopers with on-point each wave, with all 12 troopers having frenetic. The safest way to assemble this army is to have a theme army with a mix of starting on-point and frenetic troopers. Or you could have an all frenetic army and hope that 3-6 of them have on-point (This does not look bad either )
So..........
Which is better, on point or frenetic?? It depends but with spies: on-point > frenetic (Must answer this since you post your dilemma regarding your spies )
Which do you prefer? A theme army with mixed starting on-point and frenetic troopers or if feeling lucky an all frenetic army and hope that 3-6 of them has on-point.

DISCLAIMER: In practical army building, I still prefer going with smart as starting skill since for me it is the most easiest way to get both on-point and frenetic unlike starting from frenetic or on-point

No, you just should have taken the Camo.

Tuck'n'Roll is great, but so is just not being hit 20% of the time. You lose the 'targeted less often' feature, but that's not the strong point of the skill. All that does is move damage around your army, it doesn't prevent it. The 20% miss chance is the strength of the skill, and I think that 1 in 5 is better odds than Tuck'n'Roll triggering.

Well I generally prefer tuck n' roll. Tuck n' roll replaces a normal hit by a tuck n' roll. It is most effective on high HP because they can take more hits and so, have more chance of activating tuck n' roll.

The other strength of T&R is avoiding a full burst (from a burst weapon). If he gets more HP on a future level-up, T&R will become better than camo.

On july 4, 2013
Venhiem

hi all
can anyone tell me whats up with the army colours? are they random, can we change them.
also, how many armies can we create from one PC? is there a thread or rule or something?
i'm new here so dont mind if i shouldnt post it here. thanks
On july 5, 2013
Kompera

They are random.
You cannot change them.
You can create infinite armies from a single PC.

The limitations seem to be:
- You cannot create recruit armies for your own armies
- Only two recruit armies created for a single other army
- You may need to clear your flash cache and/or change your IP in order to create additional armies

Others may have additional or contradictory information.
On july 5, 2013
[281455]
Venhiemhi all
can anyone tell me whats up with the army colours? are they random, can we change them.
also, how many armies can we create from one PC? is there a thread or rule or something?
i'm new here so dont mind if i shouldnt post it here. thanks

1. Colors:
There're 6 colors only.

Your army color is defined by the color of starting trooper.

If you create a new army under existing one, then colors of starting troopers are random.

If you create a new army under one of bots in minitroopers then all colors of starting troopers in the offer are the same and they are difined by the color of bot army: wiki: General Help > Army > Colour Choice

Offer: new colors (if it's not a bot army) and skills of starting troopers change after each MT server reset (at midnight, Paris time) or after changing an IP address.

2. How many armies are you able to create:

You can create two armies only for each non-bot army without changing an IP address for all the time.

As Kompera said, If you create a new army X with single computer/IP address then you won't be able to create a new additional army aka recruit under your X army with the same computer/IP address (check FYI 2 below, it also let you create recruits under your own army with the same computer after changing an IP/cleaning cookies etc etc... it's much easlier if you have dynamic IP)

You can create two armies per day for bot armies every day. Not two for each, just two for all bots per day without changing an IP address.
e.g. 2 armies for bot A OR 1 army for bot B and 1 army for bot C.

But two armies total per day without changing an IP address
e.g. 1 army under existing one and 1 army upder the bot OR 2 armies for the bot(s) OR 2 armies under existing one OR 1 army under existing army A and 1 army under existing army B etc

FYI : sometimes MT may not let you create even one army per day without changing of something (cookies and other stuff)!

FYI 2: if you have either dynamic or static IP there are differnt ways of creating more than two armies a day.
I can tell you more about if via twinoid private messages like this: there are a few ways of sending pm's and at this pic, I clicked on your name to show how it works.
But I'm quite busy nowadays, anyway I think I'll find the time to response.

P.S. The Forum Rules are here. All most important threads are locked at the top of the first page. And I think that it's better to ask questions in this thread, cuz it's more comfortable to do than usage of Ask Questions Here #2

It's probably just poorly written abilities. A great many abilities are limited to just a few uses but make zero mention of this in their descriptions. Faceboot, Wrestler, Reverse Attack, First Aid, the list goes on and on.

Kompera

Let's be sure to distinguish between Grenade, Gas Grenade, Glue Grenade, etc.

When you said that troopers with Blind Fury still missed horribly with grenades, my assumption was that you were talking about Grenade, the very low accuracy thrown weapon.

If Blind Fury troopers who were blinded missed with a Gas Grenade, that's a whole different story. Those are typically pretty accurate, and although a single case of them missing isn't demonstrating a trend, it's something to keep in mind.

I've seen Gas Grenades miss without the throwing trooper being blinded, so it's not completely outrageous that a blinded trooper with Blind Fury missed a toss of a Gas Grenade.

Now, army.swf is a decently-sized file, but what the heck is all the FlashVars data for, then

The FlashVars data is longer for longer replays... I really think that the Minitroopers SWF will accept any valid replay string, and any other files that get loaded are just static files. I figure that these external replay pages will last as long as the game does, which is good enough for now


MT isn't dumb, I have confidence that they don't have inefficient code that spits out a really long string, which has the sole purpose of telling their SWF file to contact the server (again) to load some more data from the database. KOFKOREA, you are wrong. On page "Command my troop" use zoom (in chrome it is ctrl++ or ctrl+- https://support.google.com/chrome/ans... hl=en ) and you will see all of your recruits. After click on it you will see a link with name of that troop/army above button "Recruit a trooper"

Its not possible to change order of your recruits, it is depend on their level.

It's been a long time coming, but I'm up to 12 knife-fighting troopers at last.

Bring on the useless upgrades!

I dont think that many upgrades are useless. Here are the upgrades i find useless.

Default Pistol - Does very low damage
Rocket Launcher - Misses too often
Barrel Extension - Does not help very much
Atanomy - Very bad disadvantage
Vendetta - 50 Initiative is not really much. You have to have lots of teamates die to gain advantage from this skill.
Tail Gunner - Only works with full-auto weapons. Causes you to lose ammo faster
Rucksack - Only refuels ammo for currently wielded weapon. Only useable once. Munition men can refuel all ammo for all troopers weapons. The latter can also be used an infinite number of times.

Those armies are old enough. For e.g., my AVIATION AT NIGHT was created about 12th Nov 2012 for The English Server Cup #2 (battleground is here).

1. This army got 16 recruits soon after I created it and number of recruits is still the same!

2. Army does 10-11 raids (40-44 T), 3 battles (6T) and mission (~2T) almost every day, so it's ~48 - ~52 T per day

3. 35.816 / ~52 = ~688.769 days of trainings and remember that low level recruits can't get a lot of raids (which means I played it more... let's round to 700 days! ), so I had to lvl up them enough to reach 10-11 raids per day.

Atomizer

The really sad thing is, that's about the least beneficial combo of perks a level 1 trooper can have

(the basic sniper rifle gets lucky more often, but the basic pistol works with more perks and works at close range, so it's ultimately better... but later)

I personally like the basic Assault Rifle as a starting weapon.
Sure, all other ARs are better than it, but the Sniper can fail at killing a 10 HP trooper if you're unlucky, the Shotgun usually reloads before sunset, but not always. And I'm not a fan of the Pistol because of the measly 4 rounds you get.
Still, any of those can prove useful by not leaving you unarmed, unless your trooper decides to reload when a single punch could have done the job.

On october 12, 2022
gunshed

I discovered a fix for those who are interested. Since the DNS is down, you need to manually route the IP for the server.

See http://wahldev.com/local-dns-settings...

You will need to change ownership of the host file since it is system32.
In the host file, enter the new mappings as follows:
178.32.132.64 minitroopers.com
178.32.132.64 data.minitroopers.com
178.32.132.64 "your-army-name".minitroopers.com

Replace your army name without the quotes for every army you wish to use.
Don't forget to DNS flush in CMD: ipconfig /flushdns

Let me know if you have any questions.

There is a discord server for the EternalTwin project. Most of the channels are in French but I was able to translate this fix from the Minitroopers channel. Thanks to EternalTwin for this fix. Not sure how much longer the servers will be up, but fingers crossed this for the future of the site. Hopefully they just forgot to renew DNS and don't plan on ending the server...
